abstract: Authorities in China seem to be completely uninterested in getting to the bottom of auditing scandals, whose victims are American or Canadian investors, Floyd Norris writes in The New York Times. “Even regulators in Hong Kong have voiced frustration with their mainland colleagues,” he says.
